hints.content:
When we add a number, we jump that distance to the right on the number line.

To show $\blueD{4}+\blueD{4}+\blueD{4}$, we need to show $\maroonD{3}$ jumps of $\blueD{4}$ units.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 12 with tick marks at 4, 8, and 12. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 4, 8, and 12. Each arrow is labeled plus 4. !

hints.content:
This number line best represents $3\times 4$:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 12 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 4, 8, and 12. !

choices.content: ![A number line labeled 0 to 4 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 3 and 4.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e09db3f39b20b6ed2d2f10bd160499d177a7ea62)

![A number line labeled 0 to 9 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 3, 6, and 9.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d4c564aa4cfba65da1005833c054e4669d4d41ed)

![A number line labeled 0 to 12 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 4, 8, and 12.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/52e2f20dff1bb1ec9e0bf14c0e835e7243a2e369)
